title: Rush command-line.json config file
description: For use with the Rush tool, this file defines custom command line commands. See http://rushjs.io for details.

commandKind.title: Command Kind
commandKind.description: Indicates the kind of command: "bulk" commands are run separately for each project; "global" commands are run once for the entire repository.

name.title: Custom Command Name
name.description: The name of the custom command, which can be invoked via "rush <name>"

summary.title: Custom Command Summary
summary.description: A short summary of the custom command, which will appear when printing command line usage (e.g. "rush --help")

description.title: Custom Command Description
description.description: A detailed description of the command, which appears when requesting help for the command (e.g. "rush --help my-command"). If omitted, the summary will be used.

safeForSimultaneousRushProcesses.title: Safe For Simultaneous Rush Processes
safeForSimultaneousRushProcesses.description: By default, Rush operations acquire a lock file which prevents multiple commands from executing simultaneously in the same repo folder.  (For example, it would be a mistake to run "rush install" and "rush build" at the same time.)  If your command makes sense to run concurrently with other operations, set safeForSimultaneousRushProcesses=true to disable this protection.  In particular, this is needed for custom scripts that invoke other Rush commands.

bulkCommand.title: Bulk Command
bulkCommand.description: A custom command that is run separately for each project in the repository

shellCommand.title: Shell Command
shellCommand.description:
(Optional) If the "shellCommand" field is set for a bulk command, Rush will invoke it for each selected project; otherwise, Rush will invoke the package.json "scripts" entry matching Rush command name.

The string is the path to a script that will be invoked using the OS shell. The working directory will be the folder that contains rush.json.  If custom parameters are associated with this command, their values will be appended to the end of this string.

enableParallelism.title: enableParallelism
enableParallelism.description: If true then this command can be run in parallel, i.e. executed simultaneously for multiple projects.

allowOversubscription.title: allowOversubscription
allowOversubscription.description: Controls whether weighted operations can start when the total weight would exceed the limit but is currently below the limit. This setting only applies when "enableParallelism" is true and operations have a "weight" property configured in their rush-project.json "operationSettings". Choose true (the default) to favor parallelism.  Choose false to strictly stay under the limit.

ignoreDependencyOrder.title: ignoreDependencyOrder
ignoreDependencyOrder.description: Normally projects will be processed according to their dependency order: a given project will not start processing the command until all of its dependencies have completed.  This restriction doesn't apply for certain operations, for example, a "clean" task that deletes output files.  In this case you can set "ignoreDependencyOrder" to true to increase parallelism.

ignoreMissingScript.title: Ignore Missing Script
ignoreMissingScript.description: Normally Rush requires that each project's package.json has a "scripts" entry matching the custom command name. To disable this check, set "ignoreMissingScript" to true.

incremental.title: Incremental
incremental.description: If true then this command will be incremental like the built-in "build" and "rebuild" commands

allowWarningsInSuccessfulBuild.title: Allow Warnings in Successful Build
allowWarningsInSuccessfulBuild.description: By default, Rush returns a nonzero exit code if errors or warnings occur during build. If this option is set to "true", Rush will return a zero exit code if warnings occur.

watchForChanges.title: Watch For Changes
watchForChanges.description: (EXPERIMENTAL) Normally Rush terminates after the command finishes. If this option is set to "true" Rush will instead enter a loop where it watches the file system for changes to the selected projects. Whenever a change is detected, the command will be invoked again for the changed project and any selected projects that directly or indirectly depend on it. For details, refer to the website article "Using watch mode".

disableBuildCache.title: Disable build cache.
disableBuildCache.description: Disable build cache for this action. This may be useful if this command affects state outside of projects' own folders. If the build cache is not configured, this also disables the legacy skip detection logic.

globalCommand.title: Global Command
globalCommand.description: A custom command that is run once for the entire repository

shellCommand.title: Shell Command
shellCommand.description: A command that that will be invoked using the OS shell. The working directory will be the folder that contains rush.json. Additional command-line parameters may be appended to the end of this string.

autoinstallerName.title: Autoinstaller Name
autoinstallerName.description:
If your "shellCommand" script depends on NPM packages, the recommended best practice is to make it into a regular Rush project that builds using your normal toolchain.  In cases where the command needs to work without first having to run "rush build", the recommended practice is to publish the project to an NPM registry and use common/scripts/install-run.js to launch it.

Autoinstallers offer another possibility: They are folders under "common/autoinstallers" with a package.json file and shrinkwrap file. Rush will automatically invoke the package manager to install these dependencies before an associated command is invoked.  Autoinstallers have the advantage that they work even in a branch where "rush install" is broken, which makes them a good solution for Git hook scripts.  But they have the disadvantages of not being buildable projects, and of increasing the overall installation footprint for your monorepo.

The "autoinstallerName" setting must not contain a path and must be a valid NPM package name.

For example, the name "my-task" would map to "common/autoinstallers/my-task/package.json", and the "common/autoinstallers/my-task/node_modules/.bin" folder would be added to the shell PATH when invoking the "shellCommand".

phasedCommand.title: Phased Command
phasedCommand.description: A command that contains multiple phases, that are run separately for each project

enableParallelism.title: enableParallelism
enableParallelism.description: If true then this command can be run in parallel, i.e. executed simultaneously for multiple projects.

allowOversubscription.title: allowOversubscription
allowOversubscription.description: Controls whether weighted operations can start when the total weight would exceed the limit but is currently below the limit. This setting only applies when "enableParallelism" is true and operations have a "weight" property configured in their rush-project.json "operationSettings". Choose true (the default) to favor parallelism.  Choose false to strictly stay under the limit.

incremental.title: Incremental
incremental.description: If true then this command's phases will be incremental and support caching.

phases.title: Phases
phases.description: List the phases associated with this command. Note that phases with dependencies will be implicitly included even if they aren't explicitly enumerated in this property.

disableBuildCache.title: Disable build cache.
disableBuildCache.description: Disable build cache for this action. This may be useful if this command affects state outside of projects' own folders. If the build cache is not configured, this also disables the legacy skip detection logic.

watchOptions.title: Watch Options
watchOptions.description: Controls the file watching behavior of this command. If not specified, this command does not watch files.

alwaysWatch.title: Always Watch
alwaysWatch.description: Indicates that this command will always watch for changes after the initial execution, as if the "--watch" CLI flag was passed.

debounceMs.title: Debounce Timeout in Milliseconds
debounceMs.description: When watching, how long to wait after the last encountered file system event before execution. If another file system event occurs in this interval, the timeout will reset. Defaults to 1000ms (1 second).

watchPhases.title: Watch Phases
watchPhases.description: List *exactly* the phases that should be run in watch mode for this command. If this property is specified and non-empty, after the phases defined in the "phases" property run, a file watcher will be started to watch projects for changes, and will run the phases listed in this property on changed projects. Rush will prefer scripts named "${phaseName}:incremental" over "${phaseName}" for every iteration after the first, so you can reuse the same phase name but define different scripts, e.g. to not clean on incremental runs.

includeAllProjectsInWatchGraph.title: Include All Projects In Watch Graph
includeAllProjectsInWatchGraph.description: If true, when entering watch mode Rush will construct the operation graph including every project in the repository (respecting phase selection), but will initially enable only those operations whose projects were selected by the user's CLI project selection parameters. Other projects will appear disabled until they change or become required by an enabled project's dependency graph. This can improve iteration by avoiding a full graph rebuild when broadening the selection mid-session.

installOptions.title: Install Options
installOptions.description: Controls behavior related to performing installation as part of executing this command.

alwaysInstall.title: Always Install
alwaysInstall.description: Indicates that this command will always perform a standard "rush install" before executing, as if the "--install" CLI flag was passed.

phase.title: Phase
phase.description: A phase, used in the phased command feature.

name.title: Name
name.description: The name of the phase. Note that this value must start with the "_phase:" prefix.

self.title: Self
self.description: Dependency phases within the same project.

ignoreMissingScript.title: Ignore Missing Script
ignoreMissingScript.description: Normally Rush requires that each project's package.json has a "scripts" entry matching the phase name. To disable this check, set "ignoreMissingScript" to true.

allowWarningsOnSuccess.title: Allow Warnings on Success
allowWarningsOnSuccess.description: By default, Rush returns a nonzero exit code if errors or warnings occur during a command. If this option is set to "true", Rush will return a zero exit code if warnings occur during the execution of this phase.

missingScriptBehavior.title: Missing Script Behavior
missingScriptBehavior.description: What should happen if a project's package.json does not have a "scripts" entry matching the phase name, or it is an empty string. Supersedes "ignoreMissingScript". Defaults to "error".

parameterKind.title: Parameter Kind
parameterKind.description: Indicates the kind of syntax for this command-line parameter: "flag" or "choice" or "string"

longName.title: Long Name
longName.description: The name of the parameter (e.g. "--verbose").  This is a required field.

shortName.title: Short Name
shortName.description: A optional short form of the parameter (e.g. "-v" instead of "--verbose")

description.title: Custom Parameter Description
description.description: A detailed description of the parameter, which appears when requesting help for the command (e.g. "rush --help my-command").

associatedCommands.title: Associated Commands
associatedCommands.description: A list of custom commands and/or built-in Rush commands that this parameter may be used with

associatedPhases.title: Associated Phases
associatedPhases.description: A list of the names of the phases that this command-line parameter should be provided to.

required.title: Required
required.description: If true, then this parameter must be included on the command line

flagParameter.title: Flag Parameter
flagParameter.description: A custom command-line parameter whose presence acts as an on/off switch

stringParameter.title: String Parameter
stringParameter.description: A custom command-line parameter whose value is interpreted as a string

argumentName.title: Argument Name
argumentName.description: The name of the argument for this parameter.

choiceParameter.title: Choice Parameter
choiceParameter.description: A custom command-line parameter whose argument must be chosen from a list of allowable alternatives

alternatives.title: Alternatives
alternatives.description: A list of alternative argument values that can be chosen for this parameter.

name.title: Name of Alternative
name.description: A token that is one of the alternatives that can be used with the choice parameter, e.g. "vanilla" in "--flavor vanilla"

description.title: Description of Alternative
description.description: A detailed description for the alternative that will be shown in the command-line help.

defaultValue.title: Default Value
defaultValue.description: If the parameter is omitted from the command line, this value will be inserted by default

integerParameter.title: Integer Parameter
integerParameter.description: A custom command-line parameter whose value is interpreted as a integer

argumentName.title: Argument Name
argumentName.description: The name of the argument for this parameter.

stringListParameter.title: String List Parameter
stringListParameter.description: A custom command-line parameter whose value is interpreted as a list of string

argumentName.title: Argument Name
argumentName.description: The name of the argument for this parameter.

integerListParameter.title: Integer List Parameter
integerListParameter.description: A custom command-line parameter whose value is interpreted as a list of integer

argumentName.title: Argument Name
argumentName.description: The name of the argument for this parameter.

choiceListParameter.title: Choice List Parameter
choiceListParameter.description: A custom command-line parameter whose argument must be chosen from a list of allowable alternatives, value is interpreted as a list of choice

alternatives.title: Alternatives
alternatives.description: A list of alternative argument values that can be chosen for this parameter.

name.title: Name of Alternative
name.description: A token that is one of the alternatives that can be used with the choice parameter, e.g. "vanilla" in "--flavor vanilla"

description.title: Description of Alternative
description.description: A detailed description for the alternative that will be shown in the command-line help.

defaultValue.title: Default Value
defaultValue.description: If the parameter is omitted from the command line, this value will be inserted by default

$schema.description: Part of the JSON Schema standard, this optional keyword declares the URL of the schema that the file conforms to. Editors may download the schema and use it to perform syntax highlighting.

commands.title: Custom Commands
commands.description: A list of custom commands that affect all projects in the repository.  These commands are invoked from the Rush command line.

phases.title: Phases
phases.description: A list of phases that are associated with phased commands.

parameters.title: Custom Parameters
parameters.description: A list of custom command-line parameters that can be associated with custom commands and Rush's built-in commands.
